book.title: The Clan of the Cave Bear (Earth's Children, #1)

review.body: An earthquake of tremendous impact miraculously spares a little girl aged around 5 years, as the sole survivor of her tribe. Alone and hungry, with no perception of the loss she has incurred , travels through the thick forests only to be attacked by a cave lion that leaves her half dead .It is in t... more...

book.title: What Became of Jane Austen? And Other Questions

review.body: Damn good set of essays.
Fun, breezy, light.

I really wanted to like this book. Zombies, pirates and a Mad Doctor how could this book not be exciting. Like always let’s start off with what I liked about Boneshaker. I absolutely loved the idea a toxic volcanic gas creating zombies that are now walled into a city and the supporting characters we... more...

book.title: The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective.

review.body: This book is a must read, a true story with an amazing way to change your perspective.
We LOVE this book at our house! I can't count how many times we've read it since we checked it out. What a cute story!

Obviously a regency rip off of the movie "Mr. and Mrs. Smith" but really well done. Fluffy and glib, with zippy dialog and plotting that actually hangs together better than it did in the movie. I thoroughly enjoyed it.
Slow beginning but a nice finish.

book.title: Eyes Of Justice (A Triple Threat Novel)

review.body: Once again looking at the "Triple Threat" team of 3 ladies: Alison, a federal prosecutor; Nicole, an FBI agent and Cassidy a crime reporter - not just at their relationships, but also at the ins and outs of solving a very intriguing crime. Alison and Nicole, after waiting for their friend ... more...
Lame. I didn't even read past the first chapter. I just don't care to read a story about the pathetic 5th wife of Henry the 8th.

book.title: The Wall and the Wing (Wall and the Wing, #1)

review.body: This book is awesome!!!!! very interesting and have a good plot. very exciting too and funny

At a certain point, Amis becomes a self caricature. The British affectation of refusing to recognize US brand names but splattering the pages with the UK brand names is particularly annoying. But face it, the man was mostly just phoning it in by this point.

I really liked this book. It was set in a Mongolian type country, which was unusual and unexpected. I really enjoyed the personality of the narrator, and I didn't see the ending coming, which was nice.

Originally posted on my blog: http://libraryladyhylary.blogspot.com ! Check it out for more reviews!

In 1960 New Orleans, thirteen-year-old Sophie Martineau is struggling to cope with her parents’ recent divorce. Her father has moved to New York City, and her former best friend is no longer... more...

book.title: The Elephant Scientist (Scientists in the Field series)

review.body: Lovely. Moving. Informative. Perfect for middle school.
Reflective of Amis's disgust with the Soviet avant garde. "They're anti Soviet, therefore they must rock!" No, they can suck. Hard learning, but live with it.
Free Nook book a few months back. Uninteresting. 0 stars.
This book made laugh til I cried AND peed my pants.
I NEED TO KNOW WHEN THIS BOOK IS GOING TO BE PUBLISHED. Does anybody know the exact date????
